title: Sources: Seahawks to hire 49ers' Fleury as OC
content: The Seahawks are expected to hire 49ers tight ends coach Brian Fleury as their offensive coordinator, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter on Sunday.

title: Sources: Raiders to hire Seahawks' Janocko as OC
content: Seahawks QB coach Andrew Janocko is expected to be hired as the Raiders' offensive coordinator, sources told ESPN.

title: Machado: Dodgers' spending 'great for the game'
content: Padres star Manny Machado has no problem with the rival Dodgers continuing to spend on players while his own team -- and others -- takes a backseat in free agency.

title: Wilson drops gloves in rare Olympic hockey fight
content: Tom Wilson dropped the gloves late in Canada's game against France, going after the player who delivered a forearm to the head of teammate Nathan MacKinnon minutes earlier.

title: Harper: Taken aback by Phillies' public critique
content: Phillies first baseman Bryce Harper says "it's kind of wild to me still" that president of baseball operations Dave Dombrowski suggested in October that the two-time NL MVP may no longer be an elite player.

title: Allgaier, Hamlin part of 20-car crash at Daytona
content: A 20-car crash just past the midway point of the Daytona 500 on Sunday involved leader Justin Allgaier, three-time race winner Denny Hamlin and several other contenders.

title: Former UFC champ Velasquez released on parole
content: Former UFC heavyweight champion Cain Velasquez has been released on parole from California state prison.

title: üèà One key offseason question for every NFL team
content: Which teams will make a splash move? Which teams must make adjustments? We answered big offseason questions.

title: Women's Bracketology: Finding meaning in the metrics
content: The selection committee's first reveal of the season leaned into head-to-head, but the metric isn't the only answer.

title: 2026 Winter Olympics: Mikaela Shiffrin, USA men's hockey back in action and more from Milan Cortina
content: On Sunday at the Winter Olympics, Mikaela Shiffrin skied, pairs figure skating begins and USA men's hockey takes on Germany.

title: Perfect through three games: Canada grades, takeaways, top players
content: With the blowout win, Canada likely earned top seed for the next round. Here's how it happened, what's next.

content: From LaMelo Ball to James Harden, these Los Angeles NBA stars' high school r√©sum√©s would land them on an All-Star roster.

content: Awa Fam, Olivia Miles, Lauren Betts and Flau'jae Johnson follow Fudd, the projected top pick in April's draft.

title: Six players ejected in St. John's-Providence clash
content: Six players were ejected from Saturday's Big East clash between No. 17 St. John's and Providence after a hard foul by Friars forward Duncan Powell on Red Storm star Bryce Hopkins.

title: Win projections for all 30 MLB teams -- and how the offseason changed expectations
content: Fans love a big splash but don't always get one. Here's what some non-moves mean for each team's playoff forecast.

title: Wetzel: A coach's lessons on fatherhood ... from 1948
content: Joe Judge was trying to make a point to help a player get a court injunction. Instead he got a viral moment.

title: Beyond dunking: Mac McClung's quest for full NBA roster status
content: Jumping over cars -- and Shaq -- wins fans but doesn't translate into the talents recruiters want to see

title: Is soccer better without VAR? FA Cup shows nobody really knows
content: Neither the third or fourth rounds of the FA Cup used VAR, yet they produced opposite reactions on whether soccer needs the technology.

title: Why Chelsea's win over Liverpool is a first step into uncharted territory
content: After general manager Paul Green left the club. Chelsea's win over Liverpool was the first step in a new era.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United wants Juventus defender Kalulu
content: Man United are looking to Serie A for a defender, while Chicago Fire are willing to go "all in" to sign Robert Lewandowski. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Lapsed fan guide: Dodgers rule, offseason moves, trades, more
content: Everything you need to know about the 2026 season for the fan who has been away and is looking to dive back in.

title: Fantasy draft guide: Rankings, tips, strategy, stats and more
content: All the rankings, projections, cheat sheets, strategy and analysis you need for the 2026 fantasy baseball season.

title: Who's really fastest in 2026? F1's new rules are confusing the pecking order -- and the drivers
content: Formula 1's new era was always going to bring questions, but its first week of serious running has raised more than most. With one more preseason test in Bahrain still to come, ESPN makes sense of a fascinating three days in Sakhir.

title: NC, PDP slam BJP MP for spending 94% MPLAD funds in Uttar Pradesh
content: Leaders of National Conference and Peoples Democratic Party alleged that Jammu and Kashmir‚Äôs representation had been reduced to symbolism, with its people denied their rightful share of resources

title: Assault on workers while transporting cattle in Kasaragod: four held
content: They were taken into custody by Manjeswaram police inspector and his team following an intensive probe launched after the incident triggered controversy

title: Imbichi Bava hospital holds mini marathon
content: About 3,000 members of various organisations and clubs, along with students and trauma care teams, took part in the marathon, which concluded at Alathiyur

title: Cotton farmers oppose Goyal‚Äôs U.S. import remarks, warn of price crash
content: Farm bodies say zero-tariff raw cotton import from the U.S. will severely affect domestic price and¬†devastate growers; several farmer bodies, particularly those working among cotton farmers, have decided to launch protests

title: 40 lakh devotees take holy dip in Ganga, Sangam on Magh Mela‚Äôs last day
content: The Magh Mela also remained in the news amid tensions between Swami Avimukteshwaranand Saraswati and the administration

title: Assam school students‚Äô drive for urban bird nest conservation spreads wings
content: The Chorai Bandhob initiative of the children of Bongaon Chola High School expands to several institutions, promoting urban nesting spaces ahead of breeding season.

title: Debris of rockets with ISRO logo found near uninhabited island in Maldives
content: The debris of the Payload Fairing which are believed to be that of ISRO‚Äôs Launch Vehicle Mark-3 (LVM-3) washed up to an island near L. Kunahandhoo in Maldives

title: Watch: Mulund Metro accident: Five arrested, Rs 5 crore fine on contractor
content: Five people have been arrested following the fatal slab collapse at an under-construction metro site in Mumbai‚Äôs Mulund area on February 14, which killed one person and injured three.

title: Restricted access to AI summit on Day 1; expo to open for all from February 17
content: The expo will include pavilions from Australia, Japan, Russia, the United Kingdom, France, Germany, Italy, the Netherlands, Switzerland, Serbia, Estonia, Tajikistan, and Africa

title: Opposition slams PM Modi for ‚Äòhollow words‚Äô in ‚Äòscripted‚Äô interview
content: Opposition says Prime Minister Narendra Modi‚Äôs interview means ‚Äúlittle in reality‚Äù and is an attempt to divert attention from a ‚Äúdamp squib‚Äù Budget and capitulation before the U.S.

title: We bore the blame for your mistakes, Congress MP Manickam Tagore tells DMK
content: In remarks made at a meeting of the District Congress Committee in¬†Madurai, Mr. Tagore was indirectly referring to the corruption allegations against the¬†DMK¬†that resulted in the decimation of the United Progressive Alliance in the 2014¬†Lok¬†Sabha election

title: Friend recalls his final conversation with Saketh; says he ate and engaged less over last two weeks
content: Sharing the news with grief, the friend, who requested privacy on LinkedIn in another post, says the revelation has shocked the entire community

title: Tipu Sultan row: FIR against Maharashtra Congress chief; stone throwing in Pune
content: The BJP protested in Pune as well as Mumbai by putting black ink on photographs of Congress leader Harshvardhan Sapkal and burning his effigies

title: Kerala can contribute to strengthening secularism: Amartya Sen
content: Joining Vision 2031 meet online, Prof. Sen draws attention to the State‚Äôs historical openness to the world at large. Historian Romila Thapar commends strides made by Kerala in literacy and education

title: India has entered recent trade agreements from a position of strength: PM Modi
content: Beyond tariffs, FTAs will reduce non-tariff barriers and expand global market access for Indian MSMEs, says PM; urges private sector to step up and take advantage of enabling policy framework

title: Vallalar‚Äôs birth anniversary will be celebrated for three days every year, says M.K. Stalin
content: The Chief Minister also announces the establishment of a research¬†centre¬†on¬†the¬†saint¬†in Chennai. It will come up at the¬†HR&CE Department headquarters in¬†Nungambakkam¬†

title: Maharashtra ATS conducts searches in two districts
content: Raids were conducted in Umarkhed and Pusad in Yavatmal over the suspicion that certain individuals were in contact with terrorist organisations, radicalising youths

title: Watch: MeitY: India hosts AI Impact Summit to democratise technology for Global South
content: The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY) said India‚Äôs AI Impact Summit will focus on democratising artificial intelligence for the Global South. The summit aims to ensure that AI development is inclusive and accessible, particularly for developing nations.¬†

title: Across West Bengal, youth line up to apply for unemployment aid
content: Scheme offers monthly ‚Çπ1,500 to unemployed 21-to-40-year olds who are not prior beneficiaries of any government social welfare scheme; payouts likely before Assembly election, offering Trinamool a critical poll campaign plank

title: Hope for India-Bangladesh ties in Tarique Rahman‚Äôs development pitch: diplomatic sources
content: The Indian side keenly watched the campaign trail of Rahman and found that his 31-point agenda has several areas such as his plans in digital domain and infrastructure building that may help improvement in ties

title: Six from Haryana held for cheating in GATE
content: The police received information that certain individuals planned to cheat by providing unfair assistance to candidates through electronic devices

title: INDO-PACOM Chief praises Operation Sindoor, calls for vigilance, deeper India-U.S. defence cooperation
content: Remarks highlight Operation Sindoor, India-U.S. defence cooperation, vigilance, and Indo-Pacific security

title: Special pujas mark Mahashivaratri celebrations across NK region
content: Jatra draws huge crowds in Hubballi, while in Belagavi, long queues of devotees were found outside temples

title: Kerala setting newer models for the world, says Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan
content: Inaugurating the three-day international conference Vision 2031, CM says the coming five years offer the State an opportunity to bring together growth and justice, technology and humanity, modernisation and sustainability.

title: Mayoral poll: Battle for control of Karimnagar and Nizamabad municipal corporations poised for a nail-biting finish
content: With the main political parties lacking the requisite majority to clinch the mayoral posts, all eyes are now on the independent candidates whose support has become crucial in determining the mayoral election outcome

title: LDF, UDF poised to draw battle lines over Sabarimala women‚Äôs entry issue
content: Supreme Court decision to hear petitions challenging the 2018 judgment allowing women of all ages to enter the temple appears to give new political currency to the religiously emotive controversy

title: Watch: 10-month-old Alin Sherin, Kerala‚Äôs youngest organ donor, laid to rest with State honours
content: Ten-month-old Alin Sherin Abraham, Kerala‚Äôs youngest organ donor, was laid to rest with State and police honours on February 15 after an emotional funeral in Pathanamthitta. Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan, in a Facebook post, and Governor Rajendra Vishwanath Arlekar hailed her parents‚Äô decision as a noble act beyond words.

title: Study flags steady drop in Kerala‚Äôs southwest, northeast monsoon rainfall
content: ‚ÄòKerala‚Äôs average rainfall during the southwest (June-September) and northeast (October-December) monsoons, the State‚Äôs primary sources of precipitation, decreased by 12.5% and 6.1% of the long-period average (LPA, 1971‚Äì2020) per 100 years, respectively, between 1901 and 2025‚Äô

title: Upcoming election is a war between Delhi and Tamil Nadu, says Udhayanidhi
content: There is a group in our State that is roaming around ‚Äî itonly makes noise, no ambition or ideology, nothing, says Deputy Chief Minister

title: BIAL to collaborate with government to promote Karnataka tourism
content: Karnataka is a strong destination, and the airport plays a very important role in promoting it, says Girish Nair, chief operating officer, BIAL

title: Pinarayi will be Kerala CM again, says Congress leader Mani Shankar Aiyar
content: He asks the LDF government to ‚Äòpick up the baton that the Congress has dropped‚Äô and shoulder the responsibility of taking Panchayati Raj forward in the country. While addressing an international conference organised by the State Planning Board, he criticised the absence of his party colleagues at the meet

title: Probe ordered into 1,499 abortions registered in Eluru district in 2025
content: Collector K. Vetri Selvi directs Police, Medical and Health departments to deploy decoy parties and register cases against scanning centres violating the PCPNDT Act

title: VACB records statements of sponsors, celebrities in Sabarimala flag mast gold misappropriation probe
content: The VACB team is collecting details regarding the quantity of gold donated by each sponsor for the flag mast project in 2017, officials said.

title: Kanthapuram calls for Samastha reunification, IUML backs move
content: He announces that the finale of the Samastha centenary celebrations will be held in Malappuram from January 28 to 31, 2027

title: Supreme Court asks FSSAI¬†to consider warning labels for packaged foods high in sugar, salt and saturated fat
content: The top court ordered the food regulator to file its response within four weeks on introducing front-of-package warning labels on packaged foods high in sugar, salt and saturated fat

title: Tribal communities benefited more during YSRCP term, say leaders
content: At the 287th birth anniversary celebrations of Sevalal Maharaj organised at the YSRCP central office at Tadepalli, they hope more development will take pace if Jagan returns to power

title: Parents outraged after rats bite children at KGBV in NTR District
content: Food waste thrown in the open, overflowing septic tank and improper drains leave hostel premises squalid and turn it into a breeding ground for mosquitoes and rats

title: Got India‚Äôs commitment to stop buying Russian oil: U.S. Secretary of State Rubio in Munich
content: Earlier, India had said that it would maintain multiple sources for crude oil purchases and diversify them to ensure stability in the supply chain with national interests remaining the "guiding factor"

title: Stalin writes to Modi on registered Sri Lankan Tamils living in India
content: CM requests the Union government to rescind administrative instructions that barred the consideration of citizenship applications from Sri Lankan Tamils

title: Wild elephant damages car in Kerala‚Äôs Munnar, two escape unhurt
content: Two occupants of the car, both from Erattupetta in Kottayam, escaped unhurt as they remained inside the vehicle during the attack

title: MMK wants to contest in 5 Assembly seats: Jawahirullah
content: He also urges other alliance partners to give Muslims more representation while distributing tickets to candidates

title: West Bengal Chief Secretary given time till February 17 to fulfil ECI's pending directions
content: Another key issue is EC's directions to the State government to lodge FIRs against errant officials who "wilfully flouted" norms during the SIR process

title: HRD Minister Lokesh expresses solidarity with ‚Äòkova bun‚Äô vendor
content: Reacting to the viral video clip wherein the vendor from Kurnool district was allegedly forced by a group of YouTubers at Medaram Jatara to eat the delicacy he prepared to prove he was not resorting to ‚Äòfood jihad‚Äô, the HRD Minister, while expressing regret, says he looks forward to meeting Brother Vali and tasting the famous bun

title: Govt. medical college doctors to go on indefinite strike from Monday
content: The strike will include a long-term boycott of outpatient clinical services as well as all academic activities. From February 19, the doctors will boycott indefinitely non-emergency surgeries and other elective procedures also

title: Yadgir MLA writes to CM seeking funds for infrastructure development
content: Channareddy Patil Tunnur has submitted a requisition to the Chief Minister urging him to earmark ‚Çπ585.28 crore in the State Budget

title: Drug pushers‚Äô attempt to lure children in juvenile homes in Kozhikode under scanner
content: The action follows the recent rescue of a missing 16-year-old boy from the company of a gang of suspected drug pushers in the city

title: Siva temples in Andhra Pradesh witness heavy devotee surge on Mahasivaratri
content: Temples were adorned with decorative ‚Äúthoranams‚Äù and ‚Äúmandapams‚Äù, while flex boards depicting Lord Siva and Goddess Parvati were installed at various locations

title: Trinamool‚Äôs solo posture in Parliament is a strategy, not a snub to INDIA bloc
content: With the West Bengal Assembly election around the corner, Parliament is another platform for the TMC‚Äôs electoral campaign; its MPs are focussed on asserting their independence and Bangla identity

title: Survey records 17 active White-bellied Sea Eagle nests in Kannur, Kasaragod
content: Despite the improvement, officials say the current figure remained below historical levels. Records from 1996 showed 25 active nesting sites, suggesting that the population has yet to fully recover

title: Complaints over dredging in Korapuzha: Assistant Collector to lead expert team
content: The move follows complaints by residents and political parties alleging that sand was being illegally extracted and sludge was dumped unscientifically in nearby areas

title: Devotees throng Srisailam temple on Mahasivaratri
content: Darshan of the presiding deities started from 2.20 a.m. and at least 2.50 lakh devotees visited the temple town on the day, says Nandyal Collector

title: ‚Çπ1,877 crore allocated for rural poverty alleviation in Budget: MSME Minister
content: Allocation ‚Çπ143 crore higher than previous year, focus on SHG empowerment, rural livelihoods and One Family One Entrepreneur initiative to support five lakh women, he says

title: ‚ÄòHerath‚Äô celebrated by displaced Kashmiri Pandits as Muslims recall shared traditions
content: Herath festival in Kashmir sees displaced Kashmiri Pandits celebrate while Muslims recount memories of brotherhood

title: 'If the opposition doesn't allow the House to function, we will go for the guillotine': Rijiju
content: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju announced that the no-confidence motion against Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla will be debated and voted on March 9. The second part of the Budget session, starting the same day, is expected to be "interesting" with crucial legislation. Rijiju warned that continued opposition protests could be detrimental to them and suggested potential cracks in opposition unity.

title: 'Every rule broken': DOJ flags amateur plot failures in Indian national Nikhil Gupta case
content: US Department of Justice indictments against Nikhil Gupta reveal a crude, amateur plot lacking basic intelligence tradecraft.  Serving and retired officials highlight blatant violations of protocol, including direct communication with criminal middlemen and traceable electronics, suggesting a reckless haste that exposed the operation.

title: T20 World Cup: Ishan Kishan comes out of syllabus for Pakistan as India win by 61 runs
content: India turned the much-hyped India-Pakistan clash into a one-sided affair as Ishan Kishan‚Äôs belligerent 77 blew Pakistan out of the contest. After setting 175, India‚Äôs bowlers ran through a hapless Pakistani batting line-up to seal a thumping win and confirm their Super Eight qualification dominantly.

title: Zuckerberg's reported mansion purchase: Meta CEO eyes Indian Creek Island home; joins Bezos, Brady
content: Mark Zuckerberg and Priscilla Chan are reportedly buying a $150-200 million waterfront mansion on Miami's exclusive Indian Creek Island, becoming neighbors with Jeff Bezos. This move to the private, heavily secured island, known for its high-value properties and limited residents, adds to Zuckerberg's luxury real estate portfolio amidst a trend of billionaires relocating to Florida.

title: Cisco president Jeetu Patel reveals what developers company will never hire
content: Cisco's president Jeetu Patel mandates AI for all developers, aiming for half a dozen AI-coded products by 2026. This shift to spec-driven development sees human teams shrink, with AI agents tripling output. While embracing AI's potential, Cisco is investing heavily in security to prevent rogue agents, urging developers to master AI to stay relevant.

title: 'This is for India': What Suryakumar Yadav said after smashing Pakistan
content: Defending champions India dominated Pakistan with a 61-run victory. Ishan Kishan's explosive 77 set the tone for India's 176. The bowlers then dismantled Pakistan's lineup, restricting them to 114. This win guarantees India's place in the Super Eights. The team displayed strong batting and bowling performances.

title: Trump hails ‚ÄòBoard of Peace‚Äô, announces over $5 billion pledged by member states for Gaza aid
content: President Trump unveiled his "Board of Peace," a self-designed initiative for global negotiations, claiming UN Security Council endorsement for his Gaza peace vision. He announced over $5 billion pledged for Gaza's reconstruction and humanitarian aid, facilitated by the board, which he described as history's most consequential international body.  Trump will chair the board, aiming for demilitarization and world peace.

title: No handshake after India outplay Pakistan in 61 run statement win
content: India dominated Pakistan in the T20 World Cup clash, securing a convincing victory. Ishan Kishan's explosive 77 powered India to 175, a total their bowlers defended expertly. Despite a brief resistance from Pakistan, India's disciplined bowling attack, led by Hardik Pandya and Jasprit Bumrah, restricted them to 114, clinching a comfortable win.

title: Anthropic CEO again tells US govt NOT to do what Nvidia CEO has been 'begging' it for
content: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei strongly opposes selling advanced AI chips to China, viewing them as a national security risk rather than a trade commodity. He argues that such sales could lead to a dangerous AI arms race, unlike nuclear deterrence. Amodei advocates for distributing AI benefits globally while preventing authoritarian regimes from weaponizing the technology.

title: Team Canada rules out Brad Marchand, Josh Morrissey vs Switzerland
content: Team Canada faces Switzerland at the 2026 Winter Olympics without key players Josh Morrissey and Brad Marchand. Morrissey is sidelined with an undisclosed injury sustained against Czechia, while Marchand's absence remains unexplained. Seth Jarvis is set to make his Olympic debut, replacing Morrissey on the third line, with Travis Sanheim also stepping into the lineup.

title: act check: Viral crash video falsely linked to Jutta Leerdam wardrobe malfunction
content: The viral video claiming to show Jutta Leerdam crashing and tearing her suit at the Winter Olympics is false. The clip actually shows Suzanne Schulting at a December 2025 World Cup race in Norway, as reported by NU.nl. Meanwhile, Leerdam won gold at Milano Cortina 2026, with Jake Paul celebrating emotionally.

title: Charlie Kirk Honored by TPUSA Amid Backlash Over Bad Bunny Super Bowl Show
content: Super Bowl LX became a cultural flashpoint as Bad Bunny‚Äôs historic halftime show unfolded alongside a TPUSA alternative event honoring the late Charlie Kirk. Supporters paid tribute to Kirk with dedicated performances, while Bad Bunny delivered a cinematic, message driven production featuring over 300 dancers and a real wedding. Praise and criticism followed, including a sharp reaction from President Trump. The night highlighted a divided audience and two competing visions sharing the same stage.

title: Iran-US indirect talks: Tehran‚Äôs top diplomat travels to Geneva for second round
content: Iran's foreign minister heads to Geneva for crucial indirect nuclear talks with the US, mediated by Oman. This follows earlier discussions that stalled due to regional conflict. Tehran seeks economic benefits, including sanctions relief, while Washington demands a halt to uranium enrichment. Tensions remain high with potential military action looming.

title: Ishan Kishan's blazing fifty helps India rewrite T20 World Cup history vs Pakistan
content: India achieved a record T20 World Cup score against Pakistan, posting 175 for seven. Ishan Kishan's explosive 77 off 40 balls anchored the innings on a tricky Colombo pitch. Despite a mid-innings wobble triggered by Saim Ayub, Suryakumar Yadav and Shivam Dube provided crucial support, ensuring India set a new high in this intense rivalry.

title: Six of top-10 firms lose over Rs 3 lakh crore in market cap; TCS, Infosys hit hard
content: Top Indian firms saw over Rs 3 lakh crore wiped off their market value last week, with IT giants TCS and Infosys leading the decline. A broad market selloff, fueled by global cues and AI disruption fears impacting tech stocks, dragged down valuations. However, select banking and financial stocks like SBI managed to gain.

title: 2026‚Äì27 Rural Development Budget: VB-G RAM G gets 40% of funds; MGNREGS sees 66% cut
content: A new rural employment scheme, VB-G RAM G, has secured the largest budget share, overshadowing MGNREGA with a significant allocation. While MGNREGA faces a sharp funding cut, other key rural development projects like PMAY-G and PMGSY have seen substantial increases. The shift in fund-sharing for VB-G RAM G could impact state government spending.

title: Budget avoided populism, focused on productive capex to power ‚ÄòReform Express‚Äô: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Modi highlighted the Union Budget's focus on productive spending and record infrastructure outlays, steering clear of populism for sustainable growth. He emphasized plugging structural gaps, pursuing reforms, and laying foundations for a developed India, marking the 'next level' of the nation's journey. The Budget prioritizes long-term assets over short-term gains.

title: A 75-year-old man cycled 300 km with his wife: A heartwarming story that defines marriage
content: An elderly man, Babu Lohar, pedalled 300 kilometres on a modified cycle rickshaw to get his paralysed wife, Jyoti, specialised medical treatment. Their arduous nine-day journey, driven by unwavering devotion, highlighted the profound strength of their bond. Despite facing further setbacks, their story exemplifies love's quiet persistence and extraordinary action.

title: Ishan, Hardik, Tilak: Saim Ayub's triple strike stuns India in Colombo
content: Saim Ayub's crucial bowling spell shifted momentum in Pakistan's favor during their T20 World Cup match against India. He dismissed key Indian batsmen Ishan Kishan and Tilak Varma, followed by a golden duck for Hardik Pandya. Ayub's impressive figures of three wickets for 25 runs in four overs significantly impacted the game's progression.

title: 'White-collar' terror probe: Doctors formed 'Ansar Interim' to carry out attacks
content: A new terror outfit, 'Ansar Interim,' formed by radicalised doctors, has been exposed by J&K Police. The group, allegedly linked to Al-Qaeda, planned subversive activities, including IED attacks. Investigations revealed procurement of explosive materials and attempts to recruit members, with a key operative planning a VBIED blast.

title: Name's Trump. Donald J Trump: US prez's blitz to stamp his name on America ... and beyond
content: President Donald Trump has actively sought to brand institutions and assets with his name during his presidency. From renaming roads and government websites to proposing battleships and even currency, Trump has pursued a strategy of shaping his legacy by attaching his name to various ventures, often with controversy.

title: Economic growth spreads beyond metros; northern, eastern districts gain momentum: Report
content: India's economic growth is expanding beyond major cities, with northern and eastern districts emerging as new activity hubs. While established metros like Ahmedabad and Bengaluru lead, districts such as Gurugram, Hooghly, and Moradabad show significant rank improvements. This decentralised growth, driven by infrastructure and connectivity, signals a reshaping of local economies beyond traditional urban centres.

title: Navalny poisoned? US says won't 'dispute' report, stops short of blaming Russia
content: US secretary of state Marco Rubio stated Washington is not disputing a report by five European nations concluding Alexei Navalny was fatally poisoned. The report identified a rare toxin from a dart frog, with Russia identified as the prime suspect.  Navalny's widow declared his murder a "science-proven fact" after his death in a Russian penal colony.

title: Abhishek Sharma falls for four-ball duck in first over vs Pakistan
content: Abhishek Sharma's T20 World Cup struggles persisted as he was dismissed for a duck against Pakistan, caught by the captain himself in the opening over. This follows an earlier duck against the USA, raising concerns about his form. Despite a previous hospitalization, he was included in the playing XI for the crucial match.

title: Fact check: Was Erika Kirk arrested after Candace Owens‚Äô allegations?
content: Viral social media posts and a YouTube video claimed Erika Kirk was arrested while fleeing to Israel over grooming allegations amplified by Candace Owens. Public court records and US law enforcement databases show no arrest, no investigation, and no charges against her. The screenshots behind the claim remain unverified, and no official source confirms wrongdoing.

title: Louis Sinclair Hospitalised After New Zealand Black Foils Crash in SailGP Auckland
content: A dramatic crash during Race 3 of SailGP Auckland saw New Zealand‚Äôs Black Foils collide with France‚Äôs boat, leaving Louis Sinclair and a French crew member hospitalized. Racing was abandoned as safety teams responded quickly. Drivers Quentin Delapierre and Taylor Canfield called it a frightening moment, stressing sailor safety as the priority while officials review what happened.

title: 'Hallyu' from Seoul: How South Korea's K-wave swept India - and its darker side
content: South Korea's 'Korean Wave' has transformed from a niche phenomenon to a mainstream cultural force in India and across the globe, driven by K-pop, K-dramas, and lifestyle trends. This soft power surge, fueled by digital access and strategic state policy, offers a model for global influence, impacting consumption and aspirations across the nation.

title: 'Focus less on margins, share gains fairly with workers': PM's strong advise to pvt sector
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi emphasized the private sector's crucial role in India's economic future, urging bold investments in innovation and capacity. He highlighted his government's commitment to reforms and decisive governance, while also stressing the need for the private sector to share productivity gains with workers and invest in R&D and quality.

title: ‚ÄòTouched me repeatedly‚Äô: Bihar man held for molesting co-passenger on Hanoi flight
content: A male passenger, Abdur Rahim, was arrested at Kolkata airport after a co-passenger accused him of repeated inappropriate touching and verbal abuse during a flight from Hanoi. Airline staff intervened, moving the complainant, and handed Rahim over to authorities upon landing. He now faces molestation and verbal abuse charges.

title: Kylie Young grabs attention at WM Phoenix Open in summer frock
content: Jack Bech‚Äôs girlfriend Kylie Young used the WM Phoenix Open to quietly own the offseason, sharing sundress and golf-day looks that stood out while the Las Vegas Raiders regroup from a 3-14 year. From Phoenix to Aspen and Raiders game days, her Instagram keeps building a separate highlight reel around the rookie wide receiver.

title: Candace Owens calls claims about Erika Kirk 'absolutely vile'
content: A viral post has intensified debate over Candace Owens‚Äô use of the term grooming in reference to a 15 year old. Critic Natly Denise accused Owens of exaggerating the situation, while Owens cited details from her own interview describing limited in person contact and online messages. The clash highlights ongoing tensions over how serious terms are defined and used in public commentary.

title: Gold, Silver likely to consolidate amid Fed rate-cut uncertainty: Analysts
content: Precious metal prices are set for continued volatility and consolidation as investors await crucial US economic data, including inflation and GDP figures.  Market watchers are closely observing Federal Reserve signals for potential rate cut timelines.  Gold experienced a sharp correction in February, influenced by stronger US employment data, while silver futures saw a decline.

title: No handshake at toss: India's stance against Pak continues despite calls for 'spirit'
content: India's captain Suryakumar Yadav and Pakistan's skipper Salman Ali Agha skipped the customary handshake at the T20 World Cup toss in Colombo. This continues India's stance, observed since the Asia Cup 2025, sparking debate. While Pakistan expressed openness to the gesture, India's captain remained non-committal, emphasizing a focus on cricket.

title: Bengal man's body cut up, stuffed in bags; BLO admits murder, affair suspected
content: A primary school teacher, Rizwan Hasan Mondal, confessed to murdering Nasir Ali, a Baduria resident, after abducting him. Ali's dismembered body parts were recovered from three water bodies. Police suspect an alleged extramarital affair between Mondal and Ali's wife as the motive. Mondal's associate has also been arrested.

title: Pick-Pocket Gang Posing As "Bohurupis" Arrested In Kolkata
content: At times they were the dusky Kali, at times the blue faced Shiva, or even Durga: They were the "Bohurupis" out on the streets of Kolkata. The Kolkata Police has now busted a gang pickpockets posing as Bohurupis.

title: Trump Says His Board Of Peace Members Pledged $5 Billion For Gaza
content: President Donald Trump said Sunday that members of his newly created Board of Peace have pledged $5 billion toward rebuilding war-ravaged Gaza.

title: Top Court Gives Monk 4 Years To Vacate Portion of Mumbai's Babulnath Temple
content: The Supreme Court has ordered a septuagenarian monk to evict an occupied portion in the iconic Babulanath Temple of Mumbai in four years and upheld the Bombay High Court's order directing his eviction.

title: Man Dies 10 Days After SUV Driven By Minor Hit His Scooter In Mumbai: Cops
content: A 33-year-old man succumbed to his injuries on Sunday, ten days after a sport utility vehicle (SUV) allegedly driven by a minor hit his scooter in Mumbai, a police official said.

title: Mani Shankar Aiyar's Prediction On Pinarayi Vijayan Return Sparks Row
content: Mani Shankar Aiyar's opinion that Pinarayi Vijayan will be back again as the Chief Minister of Kerala has sparked a furore in the Congress.

title: Key Hearing In Madhya Pradesh's Bhojshala Begins Monday
content: A hearing that could influence the future of the historic Bhojshala in Madhya Pradesh's Dhar district will begin on Monday.

title: "Dazzled": Argentina Ambassador Congratulates Adani Group Over Gujarat's Khavda Solar Park
content: Mariano Caucino, Argentina's Ambassador to India, on Friday lauded Gujarat's efforts towards solar and wind energy while appreciating the Khavda Solar Park, launched in 2020 by Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: US Military Boards Sanctioned Oil Tanker 'Veronica III' In Indian Ocean
content: US military forces boarded another sanctioned tanker in the Indian Ocean after tracking the vessel from the Caribbean Sea in an effort to target illicit oil connected to Venezuela, the Pentagon said Sunday.

title: Renowned Odia Singer Geeta Patnaik Dies At 73
content: Veteran singer Geeta Patnaik, regarded as one of the most iconic voices in Odia music, died on Sunday evening while undergoing treatment at a private hospital here after suffering a brain stroke, a family member said.

title: "Malicious": Imran Khan's Eye Exam Inside Pak Jail Slammed By His Party
content: Pakistan's jailed former prime minister Imran Khan was on Sunday examined by a team of doctors after a reported eyesight issue while his party rejected the inspection.

title: PM On How India Settled Recent Trade Deals, Then A Jab At Congress-Led UPA
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said today that India had negotiated trade pacts from a position of strength because of its strength in manufacturing, service sector and Small and Medium Enterprises.

title: After Rahul Gandhi's Questions To PM On Trade Deals, An Amit Shah Counter
content: Rahul Gandhi's unrelenting attack on the Central government on the issue of farmers and the trade deal with the United States has drawn a sharp reaction from Union minister Amit Shah, who accused the Congress leader of "spreading lies".

title: Congress MP Renuka Chowdhury Served Privilege Notice Over 'Dog In Parliament' Row
content: Congress leader Renuka Chowdhury, a Rajya Sabha MP, has been served a notice for breach of privilege for bringing a stray into the Parliament complex in her car and for allegedly making derogatory remarks against MPs.

title: Ahead Of Ramadan, Muslim Leaders Ask Centre To Ensure Freedom Of Religion
content: Ramadan begins this week, during which Muslims observe dawn-to-dusk fasting, abstaining from food, water and smoking.

title: UK Considers Sanctions Against Russia After Navalny Poisoning Report
content: Britain will consider "increasing sanctions" against Russia following findings from five European states that opposition leader Alexei Navalny was killed by dart-frog toxin in a Russian prison, UK foreign minister Yvette Cooper said Sunday.

title: US 'Not Disputing' European Report On Navalny Poisoning: Rubio
content: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio said Sunday that Washington is "not disputing" a report by five European countries that imprisoned Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny was fatally poisoned with a rare frog "toxin".

title: Woman Burnt Alive, Husband Critical After Bike-Truck Collision In UP: Cops
content: A 50-year-old woman was burnt alive, and her husband was seriously injured after their motorcycle collided head-on with a pickup truck, triggering a fire that engulfed both vehicles, officials said.

title: Nephews Chase Uncle, Ram His Car Before Shooting Him Dead In UP: Cops
content: A 52-year-old man was allegedly shot dead by one of his nephews after the latter repeatedly rammed his car, sending it off the road, police said on Sunday.

title: Viksit Bharat In Sight: PM Modi's Pitch To Private Sector
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday hailed the latest Budget and a spate of global trade deals signed by his government as foundations for Viksit Bharat, and urged the private sector to step in "more aggressively" and "boldly" now.

title: "We Invite Whole World's Data To India": PM Modi Ahead Of Big AI Summit
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday said that data centres in India will be a major job creator for the youth and invited the "whole world's data to reside" in the country.

title: Railways quietly upgrades network: 81% tracks ready for 110 kmph speed
content: nearly 81% of railway tracks are ready to allow trains to run at speeds of over 110 kmph . 84,888 km out of the little less than 1.1-lakh-km of railway network has been upgraded . this is significant since the increase in sectional speeds has happened across the railway network rather than a limited, corridor-based upgrade .

title: Lucknow: Woman dies during childbirth; Class 12 student, BA graduate held for illegal C-section
content: a class 12 student and an arts graduate allegedly performed a caesarean surgery at an unregistered private hospital . the accused were identified as Yogesh Verma (32), a BA graduate from malipur, and Shubham Vishwakarma (19), an intermediate student from Sultanpur . Priyanka was admitted to the hospital on february 5 for delivery .

title: Kyle Tucker's Dodgers contract: Final blow for labor peace?

title: Follow live: USA in complete control against Germany in group stage
content: Emily Kaplan talks with Noah Hanifin, Matt Boldy and Jake Guentzel following the U.S men's hockey team's 6-3 win over Denmark. (0:54) Following a  5-1 win  over Latvia and a slightly more dramatic  6-3 win  against Denmark, the United States now faces the final boss of the preliminary round of the 2026 Olympic Games, Germany. Germany won its first game 3-1 against Denmark but lost its second 4-3 to Latvia. The U.S. currently sits atop Group C, with six points. The top team from each group gets a bye into the quarterfinal round of the tournament, which begins Wednesday. Nine different players have scored a goal so far for the U.S., including  Brady Tkachuk  (2),  Brock Nelson  (2),  Tage Thompson ,  Auston Matthews ,  Matt Boldy ,  Jack Eichel ,  Noah Hanifin ,  Jake Guentzel  and  Jack Hughes . More:  Men's hockey megapreview  |  Lapsed fan's guide  |  Player rankings Follow along live here for all the goals and top moments from the game.

title: Follow live: World takes on Team Stars in round-robin
content: this year marks the 75th annual NBA All-Star Game . the event will be unlike any other event . two teams of u.s. players will face one world team in a round-robin tournament . each team has a minimum of eight players .

title: Men's Bubble Watch: Texas rises, Georgia falls after impactful Saturday for SEC
content: the 2026 men's NCAA tournament is rapidly approaching . we'll use a variety of metrics as guides, classifying teams based on how likely they are to make the field of 68 as one of the 37 at-large selections . the selection committee will evaluate teams' underlying potential .

title: 11 draft prospects with a true first-round grade
content: the average draft class has roughly 15 players who are deemed "first-round talents" a player would have been a first-rounder in each of the past five classes . the 2026 class actually has fewer players at the moment .

title: LeBron: Still unsure about future past this year
content: leBron James says he doesn't know if he'll play for a 24th season . "you guys will know. I have no idea. "I just want to live, that's all," he says . the 41-year-old admits he harbors interest in being part of an NBA ownership group .
